reference: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 139, b(n,2).
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..414
formula: a(n) = sum(i=1, n-1, i^2*Stirling1(n-1, i)). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 23 2004
If we define f(n,i,a)=sum(binomial(n,k)*stirling1(n-k,i)*product(-a-j,j=0..k-1),k=0..n-i), then a(n) = f(n,2,-2), for n>=2. - _Milan Janjic_, Dec 21 2008
a(n) = (-1)^(n)*(2*H(n-3)-3)*(n-3)! for n >= 3, where H(n) = Sum(j=1..n, 1/j) is the n-th harmonic number. - _Gary Detlefs_, Feb 13 2010
Sum_{k=1..n} a(k+1) * Stirling2(n,k) = n^2. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 03 2018
